snippet: The decision let stand familiar base limits on contributions from individuals to candidates, but it said that overall limits for contributions to all federal candidates violated the First Amendment.
abstract: Supreme Court continues its abolition of limits on election spending, striking down a decades-old cap on the total amount any individual can contribute to federal candidates in a two-year election cycle; 5-to-4 decision, issued near start of 2014 campaign season, will very likely increase the role money plays in American politics.
lead_paragraph: The decision let stand familiar base limits on contributions from individuals to candidates, but it said that overall limits for contributions to all federal candidates violated the First Amendment.

headline.sub: 5-4 Ruling Expected to Increase Money’s Role in Federal Campaigns
headline.main: Supreme Court Strikes Down Overall Political Donation Cap
headline.print_headline: Justices, 5-4, Void Key Spending Cap in Political Races

keywords.value: McCutcheon v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
